page.title: 04Religions In Newburgh
page.content: People who are of different religions have the option of going to church in Ellon,Aberdeen,Peterhead or Cruden Bay.There is a Church of Scotland in Newburgh called Holyrood Chapel.The minister is called Mr.Wallace.Holyrood Chapel used to be a school.The school was built between 1782 and 1882.It was changed from a school to a church in 1882.About sixty five people go to church at Holyrood Chapel on Sundays. There is a Sunday School in Newburgh for age ranges 3 to 12.The classes are held after church on Sundays.There is a Youthline for children over 12 after church as well.Youthline hold discos and games nights during the week. Holyrood Chapel is named after a church that used to be in Newburgh.The graveyard is the only remains of this twelfth century Chapel.
